Reviews.Title: “nice value”
Reviews.Author: Dannie14
Reviews.Content: hotel was very close to the airport, you could hear planes landing and taking off, but once they stopped was very quiet very clean, front desk was very attentive and helpful. 24 hour coffee and tea available in the lobby. not too many places to eat around the hotel though, you have to drive to a main road to find something

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Choice for Pre-Flight Stayover”
Reviews.Author: HAWKEYE_5536
Reviews.Content: The Carlingview Hotel is acceptable choice for just an overnight visit. In my experience, it was clean, affordable and achieved all my realistic expectations. Certainly a viable option to just using Park 'N' Fly and for only a few more dollars. Save yourself the hassle of the traffic and the rushing around. Sleep in a few extra minutes. Enjoy a complimentary continental breakfast before you board the shuttle to the airport. Take advantage of parking included with your stay. All in all, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stopover Yet”
Reviews.Author: Chuck333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as a stop-over on our return from Mexico. We dropped our car off on the way down. The parking lot is located in a locked lot behind the hotel. When we dropped our car off we checked in with the front desk. The room had to be guaranteed by cash or credit card. The front desk man radioed the bus driver and he was at the front door within minutes. We placed our luggage on board and my wife boarded the bus. I followed him to the lot in my car. He unlocked the gate and I parked my car. Then he drove us to the airport. On our return I called the hotel and the bus was there to pick us up in 10 minutes. He drove us back to the hotel. We checked in at 5:00 am, thanks to a flight delay. The front desk attendant told us that we would be allowed to stayuntill 1:00 pm considering the late arrival. That was nice. We were assigned our room and had keys in hand in no time at all. We were offered complimentary muffins and coffee or tea. I declined but my wife had a muffin. The room was big, clean and well appointed. There was a king size bed with plenty of blankets, a big screen TV, coffee maker and a clean bathroom with a full bath. When we checked out the front desk attendant called the bus driver and he arrived within minutes to take me back to the parking lot. I opted to leave the bags with my wife at the hotel and returned with the car. Everything was as smooth as glass. I was truly impressed. I've stayed at more reputable and way costlier hotels and not had this kind accommodationion or service. I would recommendend this place to anyone and I will certainly be using it again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: mlb58Toronto
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel at least twice a year over the last 10 years. Some of the staff have been there that entire time. Rooms are always clean but a little dated. For the price it is a good place to stay and park your vehicle for a week or more. As I have read in other reviews the shuttle pickup from the airport can be hit or miss. This last trip into the airport took 45 min after I had reached the S5 pickup point. Having said that, getting to the airport is always on time. There are many good places to eat around the Carlingview, if Greek is not your cup of tea. Just remember if you open the bottled water i twill cost.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to lay your head”
Reviews.Author: im44
Reviews.Content: The sole redeeming point for this place is proximity to Toronto international airport, but at the end of the main runway. I exited the airport at midnight, phoned for the hotel shuttle & proceeded to wait 45 long minutes for a bus only 5 minutes away. Very small sign on bus identifies it for this hotel. Room was adequate. Breakfast in the lobby (never saw restaurant open) was tepid coffee and a hard cheese tea biscuit. (I went to the hotel next door instead). Place equal to a low level motel. Expensive for what you got

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for stopover”
Reviews.Author: Kodie123
Reviews.Content: Booked their Winter Stopover Package, $99. Hotel allowed us a reverse package, i.e. park car for 7 days and then one night accommodation at end of trip. First floor room had a king bed, sofabed and flatscreen tv. No fridge/microwave, but very comfortable for a one night stay and definitely worth the price we paid. Would recommend hotel for its' value, location to airport and 24 hr. shuttle service to/from Pearson.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: wgafOwenSound
Reviews.Content: We used the Carlingview hotel for the fly park package. the rate was excellent. Our departure room with the flypark package was just over $100.00 plus tax and our return night was $79.00 plus tax. It included two weeks free parking and shuttle. They have renovated the rooms and they are quite large and comfortable. It is handy having the restaurant attached as once you park your car you do not have to travel for food. We ate breakfast at the airport as their breakfast bar is very limited. The shuttle service has improved as they use trans swift and they are readily available. We only waited 5 minutes. Make sure it has Carlingview on the side or ask the driver.

Reviews.Title: “Great stopover.”
Reviews.Author: Ell_and_Kar
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Carlingview many times as a stopover hotel when flying out of Pearson. It's a small friendly hotel and gives you pool privileges at the Marriott property right next door. The parking lot for long term is very close at hand, and the shuttles go often to drop off or pick up. When returning from your flight they are just a phone call away and we've never waited more than 20 minutes for a pick up, unlike other hotels that we've heard people complaining about being very slow with picking them up. The rooms are comfortable and clean and the beds and pillows are great. Light continental breakfast starts at 3am!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zorro802
Reviews.Content: I did enjoy my stay in Carlingview I recommend the hotel nice beds clean room and free shuttle to the airport I love it! Very friendly staff if you plan to go to Toronto I will recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place for a Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: DukeCanada
Reviews.Content: I have been remiss in not previously acknowledging this property. My spouse and I have stayed at the Carlingview on numerous occasions when we need to be at the YYZ airport early in the morning. The staff are friendly and helpful and the property is clean and quiet. As a bonus, the beds are very comfortable ;-) Be sure to check out their parking options for trips as they may be competitive with other airport parking lots. If you just need a place overnight which we have done many times, check it out. I think you'll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation ! not at all...third world!”
Reviews.Author: cantravellerCalgary
Reviews.Content: I was surprised that the room that we rented was shabby. the shuttle was late and the staff standoffish. they had no idea where to get food at 12AM. VERY UNORGANIZED. Fan in bathroom made it almost impossible to turn on the light at night! Would not recommend at all! should be torn down. Mr. Greek attached is even worst. review to follow.

Reviews.Title: “Guaranteed with a credit card means nothing to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic767
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for one night for September 20. I booked directly with the hotel and phoned the afternoon of the 20th to confirm that we would be checking in after midnight as our flight didn't arrive in Toronto until 11:55 p.m. After our bags arrived, we called for the shuttle. After a bit of a wait, another hotel's shuttle offered to take us to the Carlingview as our shuttle had not arrived, even though we were told they are very close to the airport and it only takes a couple minutes for the shuttle to get there. Upon arrival at the hotel (after 1:00 a.m.), we were greeted by the desk clerk who confirmed he had our reservation, however, they had overbooked and they did not have any rooms available. He indicated that they had called other area hotels, but they were all sold out as well. A man who arrived shortly after we did was given the same news. The clerk suggested we wait in the lobby and "hopefully" they'd have a room in a couple of hours. Given that we had to be back at the airport by 6:30 a.m. for our flight to New York and the fact that it was highly unlikely that anyone was going to be checking out in the middle of the night, his suggestion was completely unhelpful. Since it was obvious that the hotel was going to do nothing to rectify the situation, I began phoning other hotels. I finally found one in Brampton that had one room left (there were four of us), but one room was better than none. At least the hotel paid for our cab ride to the other hotel, but that was hardly compensation for the inconvenience. The Carlingview required a credit card at the time of booking to guaranty our rooms - perhaps they need to look up the definition of guaranty as the meaning clearly eludes them. I will never book with this hotel again nor would I ever recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby treatment of late-arriving guests”
Reviews.Author: francophile21
Reviews.Content: Like many orther travellers, we were attracted to what was then called the Carlingview Inn by the good rate on Hotels.com, including free parking during our absence overseas. We arrived extremely late at night, exhausted, and longing to get to our room for a meagre 4 hours sleep prior to an early morning wake up to get to the airport in time for our flight. To that end, we had the confirmation information for our booking handy to show to the reception staff. To our surprise and distress, the hotel had not yet received an e-mail from Hotels.com confirming our booking and arrival. We understand that this problem was created by Hotels.com. That said, we would expect that the reception staff would have let us go to our room, given our clear proof of a confirmation number and the late hour. Alas to our considerable dismay, the woman in charge (manager) assisted on calling Hotels.com before letting us go to our room. Already exhausted, we were kept waiting a good 45 minutes while she tried to get through to Hotels.com. In fact, out of mounting frustration and anger, it was I, using my cell phone to dial a number found on my confirmation papers, who managed to get through first to begin to rectify the situation. Once the manager was able to speak to someone herself, to prove beyond a shadow of a doubt that payment had already been made and would be delivered to her hotel, did she do us the great favour of letting us go to our room. What else? The room was OK, the shuttle driver was extremely friendly and competent. One last note: the rug in the hall was wet and smelled as if it was the epidermis of a creature from an earlier age. We hope that it comes back to reclaim it and consume the manager at the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all the way”
Reviews.Author: Genn333
Reviews.Content: I love the personalize service the staff have shown me here. They remembered my name the following day. Ensured that I got attended immediately at the Front Desk even when it was busy with other guests checking out. Also, this is the first time in a while that I had a great sleep in a hotel as their bed was very comfortable. Shuttle to the airport was quick and driver was very friendly. Rooms are very nice and straight forward.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: luigi4vr
Reviews.Content: I booked my relatives flying out but ended up staying too. Shuttle to the airport was convenient as it took as directly to the terminal. Knowledgeable and efficient staff is a plus. There are several good restaurants within walking distance. Our room was very nice and clean. Furniture in the room were updated. Nice TV and comfy sofa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: themoneyman
Reviews.Content: .So this isn't a five star hotel to look at it from the outside, but the staff and the attached Greek restaurant makes your experience five stars plus. I stayed here for a week while at a trade show. Coming back to our hotel after 10 hrs on your feet needs to feel somewhat like home, and the staff here at the Carlingview did that. Polite, helpful and all with great attitudes!! The Greek restaurant had reasonably priced great food, with even better service. I recommend this hotel, but don't expect to much. They share facilities with the hotel next door, pool weight room and hot tub, as well as a great breakfast buffet, but the Carlingview's rooms are average.

Reviews.Title: “terrible service”
Reviews.Author: 00erika00
Reviews.Content: very confuse hotel staff, unfriendly to foreigners. i dont recommend this hotel for business trip, not even to wait for the next day flight. not worth even its low price. pay a little more and stay confortable at the marriot, that is just next door.

Reviews.Title: “Park elsewhere, stay, fly.”
Reviews.Author: GeorginaKV
Reviews.Content: Best bargain at Pearson airport area however beware you are parking 3km from hotel at Skyway park. Truly the rate was good but if you are planning on leaving your heavy coats locked in the car on that cold winter morning you depart, forget it. The parking is worked out with Skyway Park 3km away. Shuttle was efficient, bewatre at post 41 Terminal 3 all the shuttles use this stop, and you'll find many people without a clue trying to get on the van even though it is not theirs.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD BANG FOR YOUR BUCK”
Reviews.Author: MICHAELSCRIBE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Carlingview Airport Inn on three separate occasions â€“ once in July 2010 and twice in January 2011. All three stays were stopovers while connecting flights to other destinations on the next morning. For our first stay, the Carlingview Airport Inn was recommended and booked by my travel agent in July 2010. My son and I found the hotel to be very nice and truly appreciated the free shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. The shuttle bus was air-conditioned, clean, and comfortable and the bus driver even loaded and unloaded our luggage! When we first arrived at the front desk of the hotel, we were met by a lovely, polite and professional employee by the name of Mercedes. She processed our stay and we were in our hotel room in less than 5 minutes. Mercedes even went as far as to ask us about our connecting flights on the next morning and set up the wake-up calls and even booked the free shuttle bus to take us back to the airport at 3:00 am. The hallways were always clean and the hotel rooms were always very presentable and bug free. Although the Carlingview Airport Inn is not a spanking brand new establishment, it has been well maintained, the rooms renovated and upgraded and very clean. The beds were always clean, firm and very comfortable. The sheets were very new, clean, white and crisp. The furniture was dust free, clean and good shape. It was obvious that the rooms have been renovated and well maintained. The hotel did have free Internet connection which was functional and without problems. The lobby and breakfast area, although small, was clean and presentable. Coffee and tea was available all day but unfortunately, the fresh and delicious Danishes are put away at 7:00 am as this is the time when the breakfast brigade is over. Too bad for those guests that have later flights to catch! Thatâ€™s life! The Carlingview Airport Inn does not have its own swimming pool, but guests have full and unrestricted use of the pool located at the hotel next door (very close). That pool is very large and has a fully functional spa and sauna â€“ very well maintained and extremely clean â€“ but bring your hotel towel with you! It is best to check out of your hotel room at least half an hour before your scheduled airport shuttle bus arrives, as during the night, there appears to be only one front desk employee on duty. When 10 or 15 individuals are checking out at 2:45 am (same time) and your free airport shuttle bus is scheduled for 3:00 am â€“ tempers and patience sometimes start to flare up. Also when 10 or 15 guests are in the lobby and breakfast area â€“ things start to bottleneck as space and seating is very limited. There is a Mr. Greek restaurant adjoining the hotel and the food is good, the facilities are very clean and service comes with dispatch and a smile. All in all, this hotel is good value for the money and it has my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Good lay-over stay!”
Reviews.Author: krevster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on a layover from our vacation in Cuba. We got a great price on the room and didn't want anything too posh as we were just staying the night. The hotel was very homey, nice fireplace, tv and lounge around in the front entrance. The room was great, bed's were huge and sooo comfy! Nice flat screen tv and free internet was awesome. It was nice to be warm, shower, go online and rest up before our flight home to Winnipeg. We ate at the connecting restaurant Mr. Greek (I think was the name ... ) and it was great food, good lounge to watch some hockey. My only complaint was the shuttle service. We had to wait for about 40 minutes outside in December weather for our shuttle. We called twice and finally they got someone to pick us up.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Konabird
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to catch an early morning flight - second time I've stayed here and since the last time the rooms have been partially renovated. New comfortable beds with fresh duvets and pillows as well as a flat screen tv. Carpets could be replaced and the bathroom a bit outdated but seemed clean (I got there in the dark and left at 6am) Room had free wireless which I couldn't get to work so used the free computer in the lobby to print boarding pass. Free tea and coffee in the lobby area and continental breakfast starting at 5am. The staff were friendly and accommodating and the Licensed Independent Greek Restaurant on site had pretty good food at reasonable prices and offered room service. Airport shuttle runs every 1/2 hour and was on time (other reviews I read said it ran late). For the convenience and price I felt I got a good value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Not "upscale," but we enjoyed our stay very much”
Reviews.Author: flowomo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and two friends had rooms there for three nights during our vacation visit to Toronto. The price was right, the rooms were clean and spacious, the bathroom and shower were fine, and the free Internet was a pleasant bonus (you have to pay for it at most places in that area). There was a parking fee, but it was small compared to most hotels there. The lobby is small but neat and comfortable. The desk staff was very helpful the few times we had questions. The pool is at the hotel next door and the key-card to the closest door off the driveway didn't work (even after we were given a second one) so we had to walk around to the front desk of the adjacent hotel -- which was inconvenient but not seriously so. The pool and whirlpool were fine and we enjoyed them. I loved watching the airplanes taking off from the airport -- they flew right over the hotel parking lot and were very close to the ground at that point. At the same time, the noise from them in the room wasn't enough to bother us -- we slept well all three nights. Downtown Toronto was about 12 miles away, but it was a quick drive except when traffic was clogged around the city itself. You have to drive a little ways from the Carlingview to find stores and restaurants other than hotel restaurants but we enjoyed those side trips as well -- and quickly found a good Chinese restaurant and a discount grocery. Overall, the Carlingview is a good, basic hotel with some nice features and some rundown features (the glass in the big window in our room was permanently hazed over from age and moisture). We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: AVKleinburg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to flying out to the U.S and got a great deal online. We had a new room (they siad they were all renovated in early 2010). Hotel room was spacious, clean and very modern. Free internet in the room and we were on a stopover so we left the car and took the free shuttle which was very quick since they are so close to the airport. On the way out in the morning we noticed a free light continental breakfast which was a nice touch. All in all great hotel, great value and exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “New Rooms, Close to Airport!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerT494
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the first time and I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Rooms are new and very clean offering free internet access. Hotel offered airport shuttle and it was quite fast. Connected to the hotel is a Mr. Greek Restaurant with Bar but there are many other restaurants and even coffee shops within walking distance. Although I woke up late and missed it they had a free continental breakfast in the early morning hours but I got to at least get a free coffee before I left. All in all it was clean, new, close to the airport and the service was great. Would recommend to anyone going to the Toronto airport and looking for a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “APPALLING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: gweedoch
Reviews.Content: My husband was staying at this hotel for one night, when he arrived at night, the parking lot was very poorly lit. He fell and broke his ankle. He asked for an ice pack for his foot, which they gave him thankfully. After visiting the hospital that night and arriving back to the Hotel at 3:00 a.m. in the morning exhausted and in extreme pain he went to sleep. The next morning he was in such pain and trying to figure out how he was going to drive back 4 hours home, he asked if he could stay a few extra hours past check out so I could drive to get him. The woman at the front desk started to harass him and was extremely rude. They were not concerned that he fell in their parking lot and was in extreme pain. He has never seen such poor customer relations in all the years he has traveled. He will never stay at that hotel again and we will tell EVERYONE we know how rude and inconsiderate the staff are. In this economy, you would think that they would try to show that they have some compassion or care of a client staying in their hotel, but clearly they don't!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs..... never a again!”
Reviews.Author: OntarioLocal
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight for a very early flight and used their extended parking. On the airport shuttle the next morning I noticed red spots on the back of my hands. Once at the airport, in the washroom I discovered the same red bumps all over my arms and back. Upon my return four days later I waited 40 minutes for the shuttle. At the hotel I spoke to the Manager of Customer Relations and showed her the spots. I was told by her that this appears to be an allergy and not bug bites, she would look into this and get back to me asap, which she never did. My doctor confirmed these were in fact bug bites, I presented this information to the manager several weeks later and was told there had been an inspection and no bugs were noted on their report. I have asked for and to this date not seen a copy of this report. I would not stay here again nor recommend this hotel to anyone based as much on the poor customer service than the fact they had or still have a bug problem.

Reviews.Title: “Shuttle service was terrible”
Reviews.Author: woodstockboy
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as a stopover and parking when we went to Cuba in Jan 2010. We returned to the TO airport at 3 am and called for the shuttle. Then we stood out in the cold and waited for 45 minutes for it to arrive....not good....

Reviews.Title: “24 hour shuttle service works for us, a great stopover hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dogsrule
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed at this Toronto Airport Stopover hotel. I had made the reservation a couple of months prior,and the day we were leaving, I looked on the website,and saw they had advertised a lower rate than I had booked.....I called the toll-free number,and they took another $10 off each of the 2 rooms we had booked,so we had a saving of $20 plus tax....... The first time I stayed there (December 2007) we were very pleased so had no qualms about staying there again.And again,the hotel lived up to our expectations. We checked in about 11pm.There is a Greek restaurant in the hotel,and they were just closing up,but offered to prepare something for those just checking in. We went right to bed,as we had only a few hours to rest.The room was clean and comfortable,just as I recalled from last time......There was some noise in the night as it was Friday night,and 4 young guys shouting and shoving in the parking lot for awhile but,other than that,enjoyed my few precious hours of rest. At 3am, I reported for the continental brekkie and had Red Rose tea and 2 pastries.Not a great selection but something to help start the day before you get to the airport for a real breakfast. The staff was very friendly, they had a free computer in the lobby you can use,and most importantly,this hotel offers 24 hour shuttle service to and from the airport,which so many of the hotels in this area do not. So,just as the first time we stayed there,we were more than satisfied with this hotel,and it is highly likely we will stay there again when we need to find a Toronto airport hotel.It certainly works well for us....

Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel for early morning travellers”
Reviews.Author: james238
Reviews.Content: My adult son and I spent a night here in August 2009.Â  Room was decent and spacious. We had two double beds. We didn't have laptops but we appreciated the free computer in the lobby where we could access the internet and check in on line and print our boarding passes without charge.Â  The complimentary airport shuttle ran 24 hours a day which we appreciated because we had to be at Toronto Pearson airport at 4 a.m. to catch an international flight leaving at 6 a.m.Â  It seemed that all other airport hotels had shuttles that start at 4 a.m.Â  We also appreciated the free continental breakfast which started at 3 a.m.Â Â  Breakfast at 3 to 7 p.m. is much too early for most people is too early but for our early flight it was just what we needed..Â  There was a wide selection of pastries with tea/coffee, but no fruit or fruit juice or anything that was not sweet.Â  There might have been something like bagels and cream cheese, but for a free breakfast at 3 a.m. just before we left we couldn't complain. It's also one of the closest hotels to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Near the airport, far away from the city”
Reviews.Author: w_ma_lady
Reviews.Content: Far away from the city, airport noises not that bad. Occasion plane. Room was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: rockey9
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times and it is always the same, excellent. Everyone from the front desk staff to the cleaning staff are very polite and eager to please. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. A great place to stay at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: phildogg102
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to Cuba for the week and had a very early flight out, so I booked at room at the Carlingview. All other hotels in the area were priced over $100.00. Carlingview was $80.00 plus tax. I couldn't go wrong. The room was large and clean with a couch and large king size bed. Aircraft flying in were noisy, but it is at the airport. Pool, gym and hot tub are available for use over at the hotel next door. Free shuttle will take you to and from the airport. Parked my truck at their long term lot for a very discounted rate for the week. Lot is not lit at all. Some guests, including myself, were very concerned as quite a few vehicles were broken into while they were gone. My truck was ok, but I will now park my truck at long term in either park'n'fly or the airport. Overall: it is a cheap, quiet and comfortable hotel to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but no more.”
Reviews.Author: IsleofWightGolfer
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis it was close to the hotel and it ran a complementary shuttle service. It was and they did but you had to wait 45 minutes, after making a call, for the bus to arrive despite the hotel only being a few minutes away from the airport. The service back to the airport the following morning was much more efficient. The reception was efficient but not very polite or helpful. The room was clean and functional and adequate for an overnight stay. The rate paid was reasonable bearing in mind Toronto is expensive. I did not use the indoor swimming pool which is in fact located in the adjacent hotel. The reception based free continental breakfast was very much 'no frills' but acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for over-night stop”
Reviews.Author: female-tourist
Reviews.Content: This is very convenient for Lester Pearson Airport and there is a free shuttle bus. My room was very smart, everything in good condition, with a view of the golf course. There was some aircraft noise, but really minimal. A free breakfast of pastries & coffee is included. Staff very pleasant. OK for overnight, but nothing to do in area, limited restaurants on busy highway.

Reviews.Title: “Average.....”
Reviews.Author: xomanda
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for one night at Carlingview on July 17th. The hotel isn't magnificent but it isn't absolutely horrible either..... the service is fine, both the east asian woman and man were friendly and answered all our questions without becoming frustrated.... A 20 dolllar incidentals fee was required at check-in, however, but it was returned at check-out. The hallway was fine when we checked in, but when we returned from asking a few questions at the front desk, the hallway had aquired an unpleasant odor. The hotel was inconveniently placed with no malls in walking distance but the keg about 5-10 minutes (walking) from the hotel was nice, as was the greek restaurant in the lobby (other than their temporary shortage of wait-staff). We didn't get up in time to catch the continental breakfast 3-7 am. I personally didn't go to the pool either, but it seems rather inconvenient... being located in the hotel next door. Overall, it was a good hotel if all you really need is a place to sleep/ spend the night. In addition, the wifi is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A_Beauceant
Reviews.Content: Near airport and easy access to main freeways. Inexpensive and simple, but clean and comfortable rooms. Fantastic staff (always friendly and helpful). Workout room and pool/spa are actually at the Courtyard Marriot (maybe 50 feet across from lobby- that close!)

Reviews.Title: “BOGUS: Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: Greatmind
Reviews.Content: We had booked a cheaper rate and the staff made us pay much higher than that. The main problem was that the staff was extremely extremely rude and don't have the slightest courtesy how to behave with customers/hotel guests. An Indian lady (ayesha) checked us in and was horrible in her behaviour. Room service never changes the towels even if you place them on the floor. Forget about getting the shampoo/soaps etc replenished. Breakfast is a big joke: they serve it between 3AM to 7AM ! and has only juices/coffee/ and muffins. You can get much cheaper better value hotels in the same area. Dont stay at Carlingview.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Fees”
Reviews.Author: animecon08
Reviews.Content: Me and my freind went to this hotel for the anime north convention and we asked for a triple but got a double without notice.Then we had to pay an extra $50 for :"Incidentals:" and never got that money beack. They never told us of this fee until we arrived even though my freind ask if there were any extra fees. The couple next to us only had to pay $20. The hall was very hot with an unpleasent smell lngering in the halls. the stay was not very good and we stayed out of it as much as possible until we wanted sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: jams33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in Summer 2006 while visiting Toronto. It is out near the airport but this wasn't a problem for us since we had a car and had planned on saving money by staying outside downtown. The hotel was clean, simple and seemed to be on the newer side. There was continental breakfast and you could use the pool at the hotel next door. It also had wireless which is always a plus. There are many hotels and restaurants in the area so we always found a place to get something to eat. Overall it was a very positive experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Boring”
Reviews.Author: lilTinyTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very simple. I didnt like how there was no place for breakfast. No pool, but could use pool at sister hotel next door.. No movies, but there was internet. we stayed in a pretty small room. It was ok.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Carlingview Toronto Airport
